Title: Japanese fund eyes healthy returns in debt-stricken hospitals
Content: TOKYO -- Half of Japan's hospitals have fallen into the red amid rising health care costs, offering investors a chance to make money off the piles of debt.The Development Bank of Japan, a state-owned lender, will launch a rescue fund next month with two private-sector partners. The fund, with an initial value of roughly 4 billion yen ($37 million), will assume the debt held by privately run hospitals and provide management consulting services as well.
